credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Tabernacle
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
description: Horizontal rectangle. See 1901-39-2625. The tabernacle is framed by reversed consoles. Upon the door is a representation of the rising Christ. It is above semi-circular and has on top a cherub and a garland. Laterally are moldings, with a high, central ogee, at left seen from the front, at right from the side.
name: Drawing
